awd_abstract_narration: This is a recommendation for an award to support research on the                feasibility of developing a novel, non-caxing ultrasonic filter.  This          device uses standard filter membranes placed in an acoustic field that          traps and transports particles away from the filter surface.  Both solid        and fluid particles suspended in a fluid medium may be acted upon by the        moving pressure surface.  The filter will have application such as              clearing bacteria from reverse osmosis membranes and for desalination           and to improve fermentation process harvesting.                                                                                                                 The research is consistent with the Environmental Engineering program           objectives.  The investigators are appropriately qualified to carry out         the research.  This proposal is in response to NSF's a SBIR Phase I             Program Announcement NSF 86-19.                                                                                                                                 An award of $40,000 for six months starting February 1, 1986 is                 recommended.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
